techniques.name: Active Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may execute active reconnaissance scans to gather information that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Vulnerability Scanning
techniques.description: Adversaries may scan victims for vulnerabilities that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Gather Victim Network Information
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information about the victim's networks that can be used during targeting.

techniques.name: Search Open Websites/Domains
techniques.description: Adversaries may search freely available websites and/or domains for information about victims.

techniques.name: Search Open Technical Databases
techniques.description: Adversaries may search freely available technical databases for information about victims.

techniques.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing host or system to initially access a network.

techniques.name: Network Service Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts and local network infrastructure devices.

techniques.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

techniques.name: Scheduled Task/Job
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse task scheduling functionality to facilitate initial or recurring execution of malicious code.

techniques.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
techniques.description: Adversaries may configure system settings to automatically execute a program during system boot or logon.
dataSources: Windows Registry: Windows Registry Key Modification

techniques.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
techniques.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities in an attempt to elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Process Injection
techniques.description: Adversaries may inject code into processes to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges.

techniques.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents.

techniques.name: Impair Defenses
techniques.description: Adversaries may maliciously modify components of a victim environment in order to hinder or disable defensive mechanisms.

techniques.name: OS Credential Dumping
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to dump credentials to obtain account login and credential material.

techniques.name: LSASS Memory
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to access credential material stored in LSASS process memory.

techniques.name: Password Cracking
techniques.description: Adversaries may use password cracking to attempt to recover usable credentials from captured hashes.

techniques.name: Adversary-in-the-Middle
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to position themselves between communicating parties to intercept data.

techniques.name: Kerberoasting
techniques.description: Adversaries may abuse a valid Kerberos TGT or sniff network traffic to obtain a TGS ticket for offline cracking.
dataSources: Active Directory: Active Directory Credential Request

techniques.name: Account Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of valid accounts, usernames, or email addresses on a system or within a compromised environment.

techniques.name: Permission Groups Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to discover group and permission settings.

techniques.name: Domain Trust Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to gather information on domain trust relationships.

techniques.name: Remote System Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of other systems by IP address, hostname, or other logical identifier.

techniques.name: Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into a service for remote access.

techniques.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may exploit remote services to gain unauthorized access to internal systems.

techniques.name: Application Layer Protocol
techniques.description: Adversaries may communicate using OSI application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering.

techniques.name: Protocol Tunneling
techniques.description: Adversaries may tunnel network communications to and from a victim system using an existing protocol.

techniques.name: Network Sniffing
techniques.description: Adversaries may passively sniff network traffic to capture information.
detectionMethods: Process monitoring for packet capture tools

techniques.name: Valid Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts.

techniques.name: Use Alternate Authentication Material
techniques.description: Adversaries may use alternate authentication material, such as password hashes, Kerberos tickets, and application access tokens.
dataSources: Active Directory: Active Directory Credential Request

techniques.name: Group Policy Discovery
techniques.description: Adversaries may gather information on Group Policy settings to identify paths for privilege escalation.
dataSources: Active Directory: Active Directory Object Access
